WaveGrad API¶

Getting started with Crawler is easy. The main class you need to care about is crawler.main.Crawler

wavegrad.network module¶

class wavegrad.network.Sequential¶

Bases: object

Sequential Object

Create a Sequential Object that contain the Layer

add(layer)¶

Add a layer to the neural network.

Parameters

layer – the Layer to add.

fit(x_train, y_train, epochs, optimizer, validation_split=0.0, regularizer=None, batch_size=32)¶

Insert the X_train y_train the optimizer to use and the epochs to fit the neural network with your datas, you can add the batch size if you need it.

Parameters

  • x_train – the input data

  • y_train – the target data

  • epoch – the number of epochs to permorm the train

  • optimizer – the type of Optimizer to use.

  • regularizer – the type of Regularizer to use.

predict(input_data)¶

Insert the input data to the neural network to make a prediction

Parameters

input_data – the input. Its size must match the input_size of the neural network.

Returns

the output of the neural network.

use(loss)¶

Add the loss function to the neural netwok.

Parameters

loss – the MSE() to add.

wavegrad.layers module¶

Layer Module

class wavegrad.layers.Layer¶

Bases: object

Main Layer Object.

backward_propagation(output_error)¶
forward_propagation(input)¶
class wavegrad.layers.LayerDense(input_size, output_size, activation)¶

Bases: wavegrad.layers.Layer

Layer with dense neurons Object.

Create a new layer with a given number of input neurons and output neurons, specify the activation function to use.

Parameters

  • input_size – the number of input neurons.

  • output_size – the number of output neurons.

  • activation – the activation funciton.

backward_propagation(output_error)¶

Function to calculate the backward propagation

Parameters

output_error – the output_error of the next layer.

forward_propagation(input_data)¶

Function to calculate the forward propagation

Parameters

input_data – the input weights to perform the forward propagation.

wavegrad.activations module¶

Activation Module

wavegrad.activations.relu(x, derivative=False)¶

The ReLu activation function is to performs a threshold operation to each input element where values less than zero are set to zero.

Parameters

  • x – an array.

  • derivative – compute derivative if =True, don’t compute if =False.

wavegrad.activations.sigmoid(x, derivative=False)¶

The sigmoid function takes in real numbers in any range and squashes it to a real-valued output between 0 and 1.

Parameters

  • x – an array.

  • derivative – compute derivative if =True, don’t compute if =False.

wavegrad.activations.tanh(x, derivative=False)¶

The Tanh activation function is computed on each element of the input array.

Parameters

  • x – an array.

  • derivative – compute derivative if =True, don’t compute if =False.

wavegrad.losses module¶

Losses Module

wavegrad.losses.MAE(target, y, derivative=False)¶

Compute the Mean Absolute Error (MAE) of the predicted example.

Parameters

  • y – the predicted outuput

  • target – the target output

  • derivative – True for compute derivative, False for compute MAE

Returns

the MAE or it’s derivative.

wavegrad.losses.MSE(target, y, derivative=False)¶

Compute the Mean Squared Error (MSE) of the predicted example.

Parameters

  • y – the predicted outuput

  • target – the target output

  • derivative – True for compute derivative, False for compute MSE

Returns

the MSE or it’s derivative.

wavegrad.optimizers module¶

Optimizer Module

class wavegrad.optimizers.DiscreteOptimizer(params, lr=0.001)¶

Bases: wavegrad.optimizers.Optimizer

Abstract class for optimizer that are Discrete.

Parameters

lr – the learning rate to use

class wavegrad.optimizers.GD(params, lr=0.001, momentum=0.0)¶

Bases: wavegrad.optimizers.DiscreteOptimizer

The Gradient Descent optimizer (GD)

Parameters

  • lr – the learning rate to use

  • momentum – Value variable between 0 and 1. Determines the velocity of the gradient descent

step()¶

Step pass for the optimizer

class wavegrad.optimizers.Optimizer(params)¶

Bases: object

Abstract base class for the optimizer.

Parameters

params – the layers of the network.

step()¶

Step pass for the optimizer.

zeroGrad()¶

Inizialize pass for the optimizer.

class wavegrad.optimizers.SGD(params, lr=0.001, momentum=0.0)¶

Bases: wavegrad.optimizers.StochasticOptimizer

The Stochastic Gradient Descent optimzer (SGD)

Parameters

  • lr – the learning rate to use

  • momentum – Value variable between 0 and 1. Determines the velocity of the gradient descent

step()¶

Step pass for the optimizer

class wavegrad.optimizers.StochasticOptimizer(params, lr=0.001)¶

Bases: wavegrad.optimizers.Optimizer

Abstract class for optimizer that are Stochastic.

Parameters

lr – the learning rate to use

wavegrad.utility module¶

Utility Module

wavegrad.utility.accuracy(y, pred)¶

Compute the accuracy of a given prediction

Parameters

  • y – the predicted output.

  • pred – the target (binary) output.

Returns

the accuracy of the predicted output.

wavegrad.utility.plot_accuracy(net)¶

Plot the accuracy of the network during the train and it’s validation

Parameters

net – A network

wavegrad.utility.plot_loss(net)¶

Plot the loss of the network during the train and it’s validation

Parameters

net – A network

class wavegrad.regularizer.L1(l1=0)¶

Bases: wavegrad.regularizer.Regularizer

Initizalize the lamda component that will penalize weights

Params l1

the regularization parameter

call(params)¶

Calculate the weights decay. :params layers: the layers of the neural network

gradient(params)¶

Calculate the weights decay.

Params layers

the layers of the neural network
